column4: Hello, has anyone compiled a custom kernel in Edgy ? I have a few problems that couldn't be resolved yet.
he has not been in the channel recently, but if you ask your question, the rest of us will try to help
you compiled a custom kernel, and when you boot it you get a console that has no letters?

To ensure maximum compatibility, I have made the new kernel that as bloated as possible, but to no avail. The logs reported vesafb driver has been loaded correctly, but there was no dispaly characters.
not sure what to do in that case, sorry
startx could bring up the X server, just in case, I suspect there's some obscure console config that caused it.
You could have installed GRUB on that driver also. That'll make it independent.
use sudo fdisk -l to list hard drive info
Ah, sure, 'ls -la /dev/hd*' could also do the trick though.
it could, but the command gives useful info
don't say that. It would obviously depend on the Internet connection.
I see, but installing by apt-get is pretty slow compared to using a download manager.
